intro: Mentha szamosiana, commonly known as Hungarian mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a serrated edge. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. Mentha szamosiana is valued for its strong mint aroma and has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
